com.github.cjwizard

Interface WizardController

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    WizardContainer

    public interface WizardController
    Interface that must be implemented by classes that want to control the process of the Wizard.
    Version:
    20150127
    Author:
    rcreswick

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addWizardListener(WizardListener listener)
      Register a listener with this wizard.
      void cancel()
      Forcibly cancel the wizard.
      void finish()
      Forcibly finish the wizard.
      List<WizardPage> getPath()
      Gets the path of pages at the current point in the dialog.
      WizardSettings getSettings()
      Accessor for the current settings map at any time.
      void next()
      Forcibly visit the next page.
      void prev()
      Forcibly visit the previous page.
      void removeWizardListener(WizardListener listener)
      Removes the specified listener.
      void setCancelEnabled(boolean enabled)
      Sets the enabled status of the Cancel button.
      void setFinishEnabled(boolean enabled)
      Sets the enabled status of the Finish button.
      void setNextEnabled(boolean enabled)
      Sets the enabled status of the Next Button.
      void setPrevEnabled(boolean enabled)
      Sets the enabled status of the Prev.
      void visitPage(WizardPage page)
      Transfer the state of the dialog to the specified page.

    • Method Detail

      • addWizardListener

        void addWizardListener(WizardListener listener)
        Register a listener with this wizard.
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener that must be added.

      • removeWizardListener

        void removeWizardListener(WizardListener listener)
        Removes the specified listener.
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener that must be removed.

      • getSettings

        WizardSettings getSettings()
        Accessor for the current settings map at any time.
        Returns:
        The current settings.

      • getPath

        List<WizardPage> getPath()
        Gets the path of pages at the current point in the dialog.
        Returns:
        A list of pages visited from start to the current point.

      • visitPage

        void visitPage(WizardPage page)
        Transfer the state of the dialog to the specified page. If this page has been seen before, move back to that state. Otherwise, add the page to the path and continue from there.
        Parameters:
        page - The page to visit.

      • next

        void next()
        Forcibly visit the next page. This is equivalent to the user clicking on "Next ", but this can be done when the button is disabled.

      • prev

        void prev()
        Forcibly visit the previous page. This is equivalent to the user clicking on " Prev", but this can be done when the button is disabled.

      • finish

        void finish()
        Forcibly finish the wizard. This is equivalent to the user clicking on "Finish", but this can be done when the button is disabled.

      • cancel

        void cancel()
        Forcibly cancel the wizard. This is equivalent to the user clicking on "Cancel", but this can be done when the button is disabled (which should never happen, but if it did..).

      • setNextEnabled

        void setNextEnabled(boolean enabled)
        Sets the enabled status of the Next Button.
        Parameters:
        enabled - true to enable it, false otherwise.

      • setPrevEnabled

        void setPrevEnabled(boolean enabled)
        Sets the enabled status of the Prev. button.
        Parameters:
        enabled - true to enable it, false otherwise.

      • setFinishEnabled

        void setFinishEnabled(boolean enabled)
        Sets the enabled status of the Finish button.
        Parameters:
        enabled - true to enable it, false otherwise.

      • setCancelEnabled

        void setCancelEnabled(boolean enabled)
        Sets the enabled status of the Cancel button.
        Parameters:
        enabled - true to enable it, false otherwise.
        Since:
        20150127
